Notes: Record holder of consecutive finals appearances in a major Australian professional sports competition.
Four championships won as the Melbourne Tigers. Rebranded as Melbourne United in 2014.
Formed in 1988 after Sydney Supersonics and West Sydney Westars merged.First NBL team to win 3 championships in a row.
Won the first multi-game Grand Final series in 1986.
First New Zealand-based team and champions in the NBL, won 4 titles in 5 seasons.
Won the last single-game Grand Final in 1985.
Known as the Westside Saints from 1987 to 1990 and the Southern Melbourne Saints in 1991.
Known as the Coburg Giants from 1980 to 1986.Merged to form the Victoria Titans in 1998.
Formed in 1992 after the Southern Melbourne Saints and the Eastside Spectres merged.Merged to form the Victoria Titans in 1998.
Known as the Illawarra Hawks from 1979 to 1998, 2015–2020, and 2021–present; the Wollongong Hawks from 1998 to 2015; and The Hawks from 2020 to 2021.
